title: The recent Competitive ruling in OCS. Riddle me this Riot
body:
The players are exempt from playing OPL and OCS since they sign a contract with riot and riot has banned them from competitive play at pro and semi pro level.

However since OOL doesn't sign a contract with riot could these players under competitive ruling still play in this OOL  (Oceanic Open Ladder)

Now if they cannot then it would be considered unfair since there are likely players in OOL that could also have a competitive ruling against them. For Toxicity, account sharing and boosting.

Assuming it would only be fair that they be allowed to play in OOL but not allowed to compete in OCS or OPL for the duration of their ban. Am I correct to assume this or am I in the wrong.?

replies.body:
Good idea. Players who breached the rules in the OCS should not be allowed to enter again, however they should still be able to compete in the Oceanic Open Ladder. I don't think there is anything wrong with that.
On a side note, I think it would be also good for Riot to conduct an investigation for the Top 8 Open Ladder teams who try and compete for the OCS Relegation Tournament, as they are most likely highly skilled players who could be boosting/account sharing/toxicity.
We definitely would do the same checks for OOL players entering the OCS
The main thing that differentiates it is that OCS is semi-professional and OOL is amateur. Also just to clarify, no-one actually signs a contract with Riot, it is with the organisation they play for.

But can they play OOL is the main question? Cause it understandable if they can play but won't make it to OCS via play offs. 
But the actual OOL split and potentially promotion matches.
Specially with the whole deal with Tainted Minds and the OCS bans alot of players got moved up from an already small talent pool/player pool.
